intro: Zaluzianskia vestita, commonly known as the nakedleaf sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The leaves are typically covered in fine, white hairs, which give the plant its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often growing in dry, rocky habitats. Zaluzianskia vestita is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
